headline: Automakers handle tariff 'punches' pretty well: Portfolio mgr.
summary: With the end of 2025 now in sight, how is the auto industry looking back in the rearview on this past year's EV pricing trends, supply chain mitigations, and the tariff-related costs major producers have had to take on? Gabelli Funds Portfolio Manager Brian Sponheimer comes on Market Domination to talk about some of the above themes and how Ford (F), General Motors (GM), and Tesla (TSLA) have been adapting to these circumstances. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

headline: Automotive tooling spend forecast to rebound in 2026, long-term growth remains limited
summary: According to new analysis from Wipfli, automotive tooling expenditures are expected to climb in 2026 to $5.6 billion, up from an estimated $4.3 billion in 2025. The increase in tooling spend is a result of all-new truck launches from Ford, General Motors and Stellantis.
